eu.fbk.dkm.internal.util

Class Contexts

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.fbk.dkm.internal.util.Contexts

  • public final class Contexts
extends Object
    Utility methods and constants for dealing with Sesame contexts.

    • Method Detail

      • filter

        public static org.openrdf.model.Resource[] filter(org.openrdf.model.Resource[] contexts,
                                  com.google.common.base.Predicate<? super org.openrdf.model.Resource> removePredicate,
                                  @Nullable
                                  String warningMessageOnRemove)
        Filters a context array removing contexts matching a given predicate. The supplied array is never modified: it is returned unchanged if removal is not necessary, otherwise a new array is returned.
        Parameters:
        contexts - the context array to filter
        removePredicate - the predicate to be satisfied by removed contexts
        warningMessageOnRemove - an optional warning message logged at WARN level in case removal occurs; this parameter is actually a template with an optional placeholder ( {}) which is replaced by the number of contexts removed
        Returns:
        the filtered context array, which is NONE in case no context remains or UNSPECIFIED in case the supplied array was empty thus denoting the 'unspecified context' case

      • filter

        public static Iterable<org.openrdf.model.Statement> filter(Iterable<? extends org.openrdf.model.Statement> iterable,
                                           com.google.common.base.Predicate<? super org.openrdf.model.Resource> removePredicate,
                                           @Nullable
                                           String warningMessageOnRemove)
        Filters a statements Iterable removing statements whose context matches the predicate supplied. The method returns an Iterable object that wraps the supplied statement Iterable and performs filtering as iteration occurs. A warning message is optionall logged if at least a statement is removed.
        Parameters:
        iterable - the statements to filter
        removePredicate - the predicate to be satisfied by contexts of removed statements
        warningMessageOnRemove - an optional warning message logged at WARN level in case removal occurs; this parameter is actually a template with an optional placeholder ( {}) which is replaced by the number of statements removed
        Returns:
        a statement Iterable that performs filtering during iteration

      • rewrite

        public static org.openrdf.model.Resource[] rewrite(org.openrdf.model.Resource[] contexts,
                                   org.openrdf.model.Resource nullContextReplacement)
        Rewrites the contexts in the supplied array, replacing the null context (null) with the supplied context. If the null context is not mentioned, the input array is returned unchanged; otherwise, a new array is produced. In any case, the input array is not changed.
        Parameters:
        contexts - the array of context to be rewritten
        nullContextReplacement - the context to be used in place of the null context
        Returns:
        the rewritten contexts array, which is UNSPECIFIED in case the supplied array was empty thus denoting the 'unspecified contexts' case

      • rewriteAndFilter

        public static org.openrdf.model.Resource[] rewriteAndFilter(org.openrdf.model.Resource[] contexts,
                                            org.openrdf.model.Resource nullContextReplacement,
                                            com.google.common.base.Predicate<? super org.openrdf.model.Resource> removePredicate,
                                            @Nullable
                                            String warningMessageOnRemove)
        Rewrites and filters a context array in a single pass, replacing the null context with a corresponding context and removing contexts matching a supplied predicate. This method efficiently combines the effects of rewrite(Resource[], Resource) and filter(Resource[], Predicate, String) by operating in a single pass. As in both methods, the supplied array is not modified and is returned unchanged is filtering or rewriting is not required. As in filter, a warning message is optionally logged if context removal occurs.
        Parameters:
        contexts - the context array to be processed
        nullContextReplacement - the context to be used in place of the null context
        removePredicate - the predicate to be satisfied by removed contexts
        warningMessageOnRemove - an optional warning message logged at WARN level in case context removal occurs; this parameter is actually a template with an optional placeholder ( {}) which is replaced by the number of contexts removed
        Returns:
        the filtered and rewritten context array, which is NONE in case no context remains or UNSPECIFIED in case the supplied array was empty thus denoting the 'unspecified context' case

      • rewriteAndFilter

        public static Iterable<org.openrdf.model.Statement> rewriteAndFilter(Iterable<? extends org.openrdf.model.Statement> iterable,
                                                     org.openrdf.model.ValueFactory valueFactory,
                                                     org.openrdf.model.Resource nullContextReplacement,
                                                     com.google.common.base.Predicate<? super org.openrdf.model.Resource> removePredicate,
                                                     @Nullable
                                                     String warningMessageOnRemove)
        Rewrites and filters the supplied statements Iterable, moving statements from the null context to a replacement context and removing statements in contexts satisfying the supplied predicate. The method wraps the supplied iterable, so to filter and rewrite statements at iteration time.
        Parameters:
        iterable - the statements to process
        valueFactory - the factory to be used to create statements in the context replacing the null one
        nullContextReplacement - the context to be used in place of the null context
        removePredicate - the predicate to be satisfied by contexts of removed statements
        warningMessageOnRemove - an optional warning message logged at WARN level in case statemnet removal occurs; this parameter is actually a template with an optional placeholder ( {}) which is replaced by the number of statements removed
        Returns:
        a statement Iterable that performs rewriting and filtering at iteration time
